titles: The confession of a papist priest vvho was hanged drawn and quartred at Tiburne, for seducing the Kings people, the 26. of July 1641. and had foure severall names which are these, William Waler, alias Walker, alias Ward, and alias Slater.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Anti-Catholicism --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
Executions and executioners --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
